author: manunlp
content:
Reposting useful link here:https://github.com/pk910/kurtosis-sync-test/

Question for <@412614104222531604> <@199561711278227457> , would it be possible to have an extra configuration field in `participants` like `start_delay`?:

Example:
```yaml
participants:
  - cl_type: prysm
    cl_image: prysm-bn-custom-image:latest
    vc_image: gcr.io/prysmaticlabs/prysm/validator:stable
    start_delay: 30min
    cl_extra_params: 
      - --minimum-peers-per-subnet=1
      - --subscribe-all-subnets
      - --data-columns-withhold-count=4
      - --log-format=json
    count: 2
...
```

Such a flag would ensure that nodes flagged with it would start only after the delay, starting the initial synchronisation for those nodes.
(I don't know how much work this feature would require, even if it is possible to do at all.)

Pro: With this flag, we would keep a purely descriptive file, without having to run a dedicated script.

author: parithosh
content:
Unfortunately in kurtosis you've got to start with all the participants at the beginning of the run, since the tool is basically defining what the services are and then you can shut down the tool and the definitions will run forever. We'll still think of if there's an easier way to do this, one approach is to block the end of a run until the started services are stopped. But that brings some weirder edge cases imo. 

Our "fix" for this is to start all the nodes we want, but just shut down some immediately. So its as if they were never started, line to do that here: https://github.com/pk910/kurtosis-sync-test/blob/main/synctest.sh#L97

We can make this into a variable if different timeouts are needed, that way you can get the same behaviour. But yeah no way to avoid the script easily :/

author: manunlp
content:
Yes having a variable instead of the 30 min hard coded would definitely help!

> But yeah no way to avoid the script easily :/ 
That's already a nice solution, thanks!
